column4: does anyone know? a command to update an specific package IF AND ONLY IF this package is already installed? (if its not installed already, i dont want it to be installed)
apt-get safe-upgrade ?
umm... aptitude safe-upgrade ?
thanks ill give it a try
make sure to do first: aptitude update
ya thanks
cant safe-upgrade on jaunty?
ah... try instead: upgrade or dist-upgrade
oh it wants to upgrade many packages... not just the one i need -.-
then try: aptitude install <package-you-want-to-upgrade>
but that will install the package when its not already installed...
true
so, you have a list of packages, and if one of that is installed, upgrade it... ic...
you can see if a package is installed with: dpkg -l <package> and see is the line starts with 'ii'
but I guess you some shell script glue with a for loop
is the list of packages in a file?
you could play with: dpkg -l * | grep -i "^ii" | xargs aptitude install
the first bits gives you a list of installed ("^ii") packages, which are then 'install'-ed
that might come close to your needs
ya im looking for a way to parse that and just run apt-get install package when not isntalled

hey i did it take a look: sudo echo "deb myurl jaunty multiverse" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list && sudo aptitude update && dpkg -l mypackage | sed -n /^ii/p | grep ii && sudo apt-get install mypacakge
